decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quick and aggressive plays, utilizing creatures like Amped Raptor and Guide of Souls to deal damage quickly. The deck also includes powerful cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to further push damage through. Static Prison and Goblin Bombardment help control the board while Lightning Bolt provides additional removal. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds consistency to the deck. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy with lands like Sacred Foundry and Arid Mesa.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful Eldrazi creatures, controlling the board with spells like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble. The key strategy is to use Eldrazi Temple and Ugin's Labyrinth to cheat out big threats like Emrakul, the Promised End, and World Breaker. Sowing Mycospawn can provide additional value by creating tokens, while Ancient Stirrings helps to find key pieces of the deck. The deck also includes some color fixing with lands like Misty Rainforest and Breeding Pool to ensure that powerful spells can be cast consistently.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the Heliod combo using cards like Spike Feeder and Ranger-Captain of Eos to gain infinite life and create an infinitely large creature. It can also use cards like Collected Company to find key combo pieces and Utopia Sprawl to ramp up mana quickly. The deck also includes cards like Auriok Champion for protection and disruption. Its strength lies in its ability to quickly assemble the combo and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the combo potential of Ruby Storm cards to generate massive amounts of mana and cast powerful spells quickly. With cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Ral, Monsoon Mage to reduce spell costs, along with rituals and cantrips for card advantage, the deck aims to play aggressively and overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells like Flame of Anor and Past in Flames. The inclusion of Wish cards adds a versatile element to the deck, allowing for flexibility in finding key spells to further the combo.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and aggressive strategy. Utilizing powerful creatures like Amped Raptor and Ocelot Pride, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Static Prison help control the board and prevent the opponent from mounting a counterattack. With a mix of creatures, burn spells, and board control elements, this Boros Aggro deck is designed for fast-paced, high-impact gameplay.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, supported by powerful aggro cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Lightning Bolt. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a mix of aggressive creatures and burn spells, while utilizing cards like Static Prison and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to control the board. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency and versatility to the deck's strategy.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on utilizing a variety of counter spells, removal spells, and card advantage to control the opponent's board and hand while staying ahead in card advantage. Murktide Regent serves as a powerful finisher, and Harbinger of the Seas provides additional disruption. The deck aims to control the game flow and take advantage of the opponent's misplays to secure victory through attrition. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistency in casting spells throughout the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing the powerful control elements of "The One Ring" to manipulate the game state and disrupt your opponent's strategies. By combining counterspells, removal spells, and powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, the deck aims to control the game until it can win with a dominant board presence. The inclusion of cards like Dress Down and Force of Negation help to answer a wide variety of threats, making it difficult for opponents to gain an advantage. With the right sequencing and resource management, this deck can outmaneuver and outlast opponents in a battle of attrition.

The deck focuses on utilizing a mix of aggressive creatures and powerful burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also includes cards that provide support and disruption, such as Static Prison and Goblin Bombardment. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion allows for additional flexibility and consistency in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain control of the board with a mix of creatures, burn spells, and disruptive elements.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and bounce effects. It aims to control the board with cards like Counterspell, Fatal Push, and Murktide Regent while generating card advantage with Subtlety, Archmage's Charm, and Psychic Frog. The deck also includes efficient cantrips like Consider and Preordain to ensure it hits its land drops and finds the necessary answers. The mana base allows for flexible casting costs and the inclusion of powerful utility lands like Otawara, Soaring City.

This deck focuses on using ramp spells like Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Curiosity to quickly get to Eldrazi threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. The goal is to control the board with cards like All Is Dust and Kozilek's Return while also ramping up to play big threats early in the game. The deck also includes tools like The One Ring and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt the opponent's game plan and ensure that the Eldrazi can dominate the battlefield.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards, allowing you to cast powerful creatures like Hollow One for free or at a reduced cost. By using cards like Mishra's Bauble, Goblin Lore, Burning Inquiry, and Street Wraith, you can easily discard cards and bring out multiple threats early in the game. With a mix of aggressive creatures and burn spells, you can overwhelm your opponent and win the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly putting powerful creatures from the graveyard onto the battlefield using instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. The deck also utilizes control elements such as Force of Negation and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The creatures in the deck provide strong effects when they enter the battlefield, and the deck aims to win the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats. The mana base is designed to support the deck's multiple colors and allow for consistent casting of spells.

This Zoo Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying creatures to overwhelm the opponent, using cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Saffi Eriksdotter to apply pressure. The deck also includes ways to deal direct damage with cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge. Jegantha, the Wellspring serves as a companion to provide additional value. With a mix of creatures and support spells, this deck aims to maintain a fast pace and dominate the board early on to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on aggressive creature plays with a mix of creatures that offer support and synergy with each other. The goal is to flood the board with creatures quickly to overwhelm the opponent and deal damage efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge adds flexibility and reach to the deck, while cards like Saffi Eriksdotter and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provide resilience and recursion options. The deck also includes a strong mana base to ensure consistent and powerful plays throughout the game.

This deck revolves around utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to quickly ramp into Primeval Titan and other big threats. The deck also includes various land tutors and ramp cards to assemble powerful land combos, such as Urza's Saga and The One Ring, to generate additional value and control the board. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with its mana advantage and powerful creatures, while also having the ability to search for specific lands to tailor its strategy to the situation at hand.

The deck focuses on using Amulet of Vigor to create explosive plays with Primeval Titan, efficiently ramping into powerful lands like Urza's Saga and Lotus Field. It utilizes Aftermath Analyst to generate additional value and card advantage, while Boseiju, Who Endures protects key spells. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly to overwhelm the opponent with massive threats and game-winning plays. With strong ramp and land recursion, the deck can consistently execute its gameplan and outpace opponents in the Modern format.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast, aggressive gameplay backed up by powerful creatures like Amped Raptor and Ocelot Pride, with burn spells like Lightning Bolt for additional reach. The deck also utilizes disruptive elements like Blood Moon and Static Prison to slow down opponents, while also having cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls for additional creature support. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency to the deck. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently.

The deck focuses on assembling a combo using Underworld Breach to continually loop spells from the graveyard, enabling a win condition through Grinding Station or Thassa's Oracle. Emry, Lurker of the Loch helps to recur key artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Amber, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student allows for card advantage and filtering. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Malevolent Rumble and Unholy Heat to control the board and stay alive long enough to assemble the combo. Urza's Saga provides additional utility, tutoring for key artifacts like Mishra's Bauble or Grinding Station.

This deck focuses on assembling a variety of creatures with unique abilities to create powerful combos and synergies. The toolbox approach allows for flexibility in responding to different situations and opponents, utilizing cards like Delighted Halfling for card advantage, Yawgmoth, Thran Physician for removal and card draw, and Grist, the Hunger Tide for generating tokens. The deck also includes sacrifice outlets and recursion effects to maximize the value of creatures entering and leaving the battlefield. By using creatures effectively in combination with spells like Chord of Calling and Malevolent Rumble, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its versatile and varied threats.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and creatures that disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to maintain card advantage through spells like Archmage's Charm and Subtlety while efficiently dealing with threats using Fatal Push and Orcish Bowmasters. Murktide Regent provides a powerful late-game threat, while cards like Psychic Frog and Sink into Stupor disrupt the opponent's hand and game plan. The deck's mana base is carefully constructed to support a consistent strategy of disruption and control.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Counterspell. The deck also includes hand disruption with Harbinger of the Seas and Sink into Stupor. Additionally, it has card draw and library manipulation through Thought Scour and Preordain. The mana base is set up to support the deck's strong control elements with dual lands like Darkslick Shores and Watery Grave. Overall, the deck aims to outlast opponents and gradually take control of the game.

The main focus of this Modern Dimir Control deck is to assert dominance over the game through countering spells, removal, and disruption. By utilizing cards like Counterspell, Fatal Push, and Force of Negation, the deck aims to control the battlefield and dictate the pace of the game. Through efficient card draw with Consider and Preordain, as well as graveyard interaction with Cling to Dust, this deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents. The inclusion of creatures like Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog provide additional threats and ways to control the game.

The main idea of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's strategy by countering spells, removing threats, and drawing cards to gain card advantage. The deck focuses on using a mix of creature removal, counter spells, and card selection to maintain control of the game until it can finish off the opponent with powerful threats like Murktide Regent. The deck also includes utility cards like Cling to Dust and Spell Snare to provide additional options in different situations. Overall, the deck aims to out-value and out-maneuver the opponent in order to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard and using various reanimation spells to bring back powerful creatures such as Atraxa, Griselbrand, and Fallaji Archaeologist. The key strategy is to use Goryo's Vengeance and other instant reanimation spells to cheat big threats into play early in the game, overwhelming the opponent before they can establish their own game plan. The deck also runs disruption like Thoughtseize and Prismatic Ending to control the board and protect the combo. Additionally, the deck has card draw and filtering to find the combo pieces quickly and efficiently.

This deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent's strategy while building up to using The One Ring to lock down the game. The key strategy is to use cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Leyline Binding to control the opponent's plays, while utilizing removal spells like Solitude and Prismatic Ending to keep the board clear. Once The One Ring is in play, it can dominate the game by protecting your creatures and preventing the opponent from mounting a comeback. The deck is designed to stall the game until you can establish control with The One Ring.
